intro: Lesquerella diffusa, commonly known as the desert sesame, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and capsule fruits. The plant produces a unique seed oil rich in erucic acid, which has industrial and cosmetic applications. Lesquerella diffusa thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various desert organisms.
